subtitleNullable: Try out your skills in CV with imbalanced data
descriptionNullable:
# Background
Landmarks on Mars have been established to study the geology of Mars and mark important structures on the planet.

## Landmarks
Bright dune and dark dune are two sand dune classes found on Mars. Dark dunes are completely defrosted, whereas bright dunes are not. Bright dunes are generally bright due to overlying frost and can exhibit black spots where parts of the dune are defrosting.

The crater class consists of crater images in which the diameter of the crater is greater than or equal to 1/5 the width of the image and the circular rim is visible for at least half the crater's circumference.

## Goal of the competition
You need to predict the landmark from the images provided and ease the process of landmark detection on Mars

## Acknowledgements
We would like to thank Planetary Data System Imaging Node, NASA, for providing the dataset.

## Evaluation
The metric for this competition has been updated from classification accuracy score to macro F1-Score: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.f1_score.html

## Submission File
The following format must be followed, and the file must be named 'submission.csv' preferably. The file should contain a header.

## Files
train.csv - The training dataset, along with labels
test.csv - The testing dataset
sample_submission.csv - Sample submission file in the appropriate format

## Columns
FileName - The filename of the corresponding image
Class - The corresponding landmark
title: Mars landmark detection
subtitle: Try out your skills in CV with imbalanced data

## Landmarks
Bright dune and dark dune are two sand dune classes found on Mars. Dark dunes are completely defrosted, whereas bright dunes are not. Bright dunes are generally bright due to overlying frost and can exhibit black spots where parts of the dune are defrosting.

The crater class consists of crater images in which the diameter of the crater is greater than or equal to 1/5 the width of the image and the circular rim is visible for at least half the crater's circumference.

## Goal of the competition
You need to predict the landmark from the images provided and ease the process of landmark detection on Mars

## Acknowledgements
We would like to thank Planetary Data System Imaging Node, NASA, for providing the dataset.

## Evaluation
The metric for this competition has been updated from classification accuracy score to macro F1-Score: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.f1_score.html

The following format must be followed, and the file must be named 'submission.csv' preferably. The file should contain a header.

sample_submission.csv - Sample submission file in the appropriate format

Class - The corresponding landmark
